quizzes.title: History Quiz: Tree and Food
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, fruits, proteins. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Although too smelly, this member of the onion family is considered to be an aphrodisiac. It also has antioxidant properties and is used in alternative medicine.
This food is a very good source of energy. It also contains phenylethylamine, which triggers the same reaction in the body as falling in love does.
Mom always told you to get plenty of iron in your diet, so you order a put out the lights and cry.  What item have you ordered?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liver and onions

questions.question: Although natural, this food contains more calories than beet-sugar. It is used in a lot of skin-care products, but in the ancient Egyptians considered it --to be a cure for impotence and sterility.
Keep off the grass in diner-speak means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hold the lettuce

questions.question: A fellow comes in on the night shift and orders a Hockey puck with wax, wreck em, frog sticks in the alley, and draw one in the dark.  What on Earth does he want to eat?

options.text: Medium-rare burger, onion rings, fries, and a strawberry shake.
Tuna salad with cheese, fries on the side and black forest cake.
Liver, no onions, frog legs, fried eggs, and black coffee.
Well done burger with American cheese, fries on the side, scrambled eggs, and black coffee.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Well done burger with American cheese, fries on the side, scrambled eggs, and black coffee.

questions.question: Due to the shape of its fruits, Aztecs called this tree Ahuacuatl, which meant testicle tree.
Chicks on a raft with blowout patches refers to what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eggs on toast with pancakes

questions.question: What is diner-speak for an order of hash?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Customer will take a chance

questions.question: A guy orders a drag it through Georgia for his son.  What has he ordered?

options.text: A slice of key lime pie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cola with chocolate syrup

questions.question: The final order of the night is for a Bow - wow, Pittsburgh on the bun, frog sticks, and a 55 with Hail.  What has been ordered?

options.text: Bratwurst, no bun, mashed potatoes, cherry coke with Ice.
Bacon wrapped steak with fries and black coffee.
Kielbasa, extra mustard, frog legs and a chocolate shake.
Hot dog, burn or toast the bun, side of french fries and a root beer with ice.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hot dog, burn or toast the bun, side of french fries and a root beer with ice.

questions.question: This fruit is generally considered to grow on a tree, but the tree is actually a giant herb. The fruit contains potassium and vitamin B, which are necessary for the production of sex hormones.

This very nutritious and rich in proteins seafood is stated to be the favourite one of Casanova. He was famous as one of the worlds greatest lovers and an ardent connoisseur of this food, which was always on his menu.
Finally, a customer orders Bossy in a bowl, bullets or whistleberries, a blonde with sand, a bucket of cold mud, and belchwater.  What have they ordered?

options.text: Beef stew, baked beans, coffee with cream and sugar, chocolate ice cream, and seltzer water.
Chili con carne with Lima beans, ice tea, a vanilla sundae and a Perrier water.
Tomato soup, fried okra, root beer, chocolate ice cream, and Perrier water.
Chicken noodle soup, blackberries, vanilla coke, German chocolate cake and seltzer water.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beef stew, baked beans, coffee with cream and sugar, chocolate ice cream, and seltzer water.

questions.question: Your friends favorite breakfast is a shingle with shimmy and shake, squeeze one.   What does he like to eat for breakfast?

options.text: Buttered toast with jam and orange juice
Short stack of pancakes and instant coffee

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buttered toast with jam and orange juice

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Drink
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, fruits, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Vodka is traditional for this country. People there like to flavor vodka with lemon peel, pepper or herbs.
The first sales of the Coca Cola drink were made at Jacobs Pharmacy in Atlanta, Georgia, in what year?
In this country people drink gorilka. It is similar to vodka.
Whisky is traditional for this country. The beverages color can give you a hint about its age.
Sangria is consumed all year round in this country. It is made of wine mixed with fruit and spices.
Tequila is named after a town with the same name in the country where it is a traditional drink.
This drink is a widely known stimulant, but if you have too much, it becomes a depressant. Its active ingredient - caffeine - is known as the worlds most popular drug.

Having been cultivated for more than 1000 years, this is one of the oldest spices in the world. However, you should be aware of its hallucinogenic properties it taken in large quantities. In Asia, It was highly appreciated for its aphrodisiac qualities.
Schnapps is a kind of fruit brandy and is typical for the country which gave the name of this beverage.
Caipirinha takes lime, caster sugar, and Cachaca, or Rum to chill out the citizens of this country.
These fruits were used as wedding breakfast in France. Newlyweds had a soup of thinned sour cream, borage and powdered sugar, and these.
Rakia is a strong alcoholic drink made of various fruits, usually grapes, plums or apricots.
Pastis is the most popular aperitif in this country. It is made with anise, licorice and additional aromatic plants.

As this drink relaxes and stimulates the senses, it is considered the proper drink for a romantic evening. The recommended quantity is one or two glasses, otherwise you will get sleepy and spoil the moment.
Ouzo is the preferred drink in this country. It is produced from pressed grapes, herbs and berries.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Sign and People
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, jupiter, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This astrological sign, ruled by Pluto, has the reputation of being highly sexual. Persons born under it, usually feel emotionally secure if they are financially settled.
Why was Coca-Cola once considered an anti-Semitic company?

options.text: Coca-Cola did not have a bottling plant in Israel
Coca-Cola was successfully doing business in the Middle East
The manager of Coca-Colas Egyptian bottling operations announced  that Coca-Cola would never allow the Israelis a franchise

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Ruled by Mercury, people born under this sign are really clever. It is typical for them to constantly try to separate what is useful from what is not.
Ruled by Saturn, people born under this zodiac sign, are ambitious and practical.
This sign is ruled by Venus and people born under it are known as peacemakers.
The acids which the Coca-Cola beverage contains make it harmful to drink.
Coca-Cola used to contain cocaine.
Coca-Cola was originally green.

This Moon sign characterizes the people under its rule as maternal. It is typical for them to hold firmly to the past, and to insist on the relation of the present with the past.  However, they are very romantic.

The people born under this zodiac sign are ruled by Neptune. They are probably the most sensitive of all, but have worked out a manner to conceal their sensitivity. They are prone to living their life in a constant daydream.
This zodiac sign is referred to as the youngest one. It is ruled by Mars and is famous as the initiator.

Attorneys Benjamin Thomas and Joseph Whitehead of Chattanooga, Tennessee, bought the exclusive rights to distribute Coke syrup to bottlers across most of the US. How much did they pay to obtain the rights?

Under the influence of Jupiter, people born under this sign always seek to extract meaning from experience and search for what lies behind the animal instinct. Having rather philosophical view towards life, a person under this sign will not maintain a relationship with a jealous spouse.
This zodiac sign is ruled by the Sun.
This was the original title of a song, produced by Billy Davis and sung by The New Seekers, and featured in a 1971 TV commercial of Coca Cola.

options.text: Id Like to Teach the World to Sing
Id Like to Buy the World a Coke

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Id Like to Teach the World to Sing

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: People and Vegetable
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, egypt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This zodiac sign is ruled by Mercury. People born under it often change their mind.  They are also known as being tender and caring.
According to historians this indigo-colored vegetable originates from India.  However, there are some written accounts from the 5th century in China, which indicate its cultivation there as well.
This fresh, green vegetable comes from India, where people have been growing it for 3000 years. Although we regard it as a vegetable, it is actually a fruit and reproduces by seeds.

This veggie comes from Mexico. It was later spread all over North America and from there, setters took it to Europe. Nowadays besides food, it is used in the manufacture of oils, paints, soaps, syrups, starches, and even for fuel.
Ploughmans Lunch is traditional for this country. It consists of cheese, a bit of pickle and pickled onion, and a slice of bread.
The planet of this sign is Uranus. The most recognizable feature of people born under the sign is their need for independence. They are positive and optimistic, and see life as a wonderful adventure.
Boza is a thick, fermented beverage with a sweet and sour taste. It is made from millet seed and various astringent substances and was invented in which country?
This low-carb vegetable was first seen along Atlantic coasts of Europe. Its in the same group as cauliflower, broccoli, kale, collards, kohlrabi, and Brussels sprouts.

This is another sign ruled by Venus. The people under this zodiac sign are really material. Good food, good clothing and furniture, good sex can really make them feel wonderful. They are possessive, but are calm and have great inner peace.
This vegetable comes from the Andes in Peru and Bolivia, where people have known it for 2400 years. It became popular in Europe in 1780, when it first appeared in Ireland.

North Americans believed these were poisonous until 1820, when Colonel Robert Gibbon Johnson disproved that myth during a public demonstration on the courthouse steps in Salem, NJ.  They were imported from Mexico to Europe in the middle of 16th century.
This orange vegetable was first discovered in Afghanistan 5000 years ago. Paintings were found on the walls of temples in Egypt, where it is believed to have been used for  treatment of diseases.
This is a vegetable with no homeland, dispersed all over the world.  In Egypt, it was worshipped for its spherical shape and concentric rings, believed to be symbols of eternity.
With a Latin name of Capsicum, this American vegetable has been known to the western hemisphere for a very long time.  According to experts there is evidence it has been consumed since 7500 BC.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chili Pepper

questions.question: This member of the cabbage family was admitted to European and American cuisine in the beginning of the 20th century. However, it was very common in the Roman Empire and was first cultivated on the territory of present day Turkey

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Country and Game
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, zi, dip. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This popular board game, patented in 1935 by salesman Charles Darrow, is known for the long hours a single game could take to complete.
Coq Au Vin is a typical dish for this country, and it is prepared in all its regions, though with slight changes in recipe. It is a kind of chicken stew.
One of the most popular casino games in the world, its precursor , vingt-et-un originated in French casinos around 1700.
This strategic board game, which involves play by two parties on an eight-by-eight square grid, enjoys a great following in Japan, and has an estimated 10 to the power of 28 legal positions.
Tandoori Chicken is a meal named after the oven in which it is cooked - a small clay oven using a wood fire.
Zong Zi is a traditional food for this country. It is a rice dumpling wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves.
Tzatziki is a typical dip of this country. It is made with yogurt, olive oil, cucumbers and onions.
Quesadillas are folded tortillas, stuffed with cheese and then grilled.
The Shish Kabob is very popular in this country. It is often served with the traditional greens and tomato salad, tahini sauce and pita bread.
Bratwurst is often consumed in this country.  They are sausages made of pork and veal and seasoned with ginger, nutmeg, and coriander or caraway.
Simon says, generally a childrens game of concentration and quick reactions, appears in which of these action-packed movies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Die Hard series

questions.question: Which of these games of skill and strategy has a pen and pencil version, played on a field of 8x10 boxes?
Feijohada has been consumed for centuries in this country. It is a stew made of black beans and pork.
Scrabble, an amusing family game created by architect Alfred Mosher Butts in 1938, is what type of game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Word game

questions.question: Pong, the first commercially successful video game, is a video screen adaptation of what classic game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Table tennis

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Breakfast and Country
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, cereal, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The popular breakfast cereal dish muesli was invented in 1900 in which country?
The special Fanta flavour in Romania, based on a traditional local drink made from elderflower, is called by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fanta Shokata

questions.question: Besides flour and milk, what is the third essential ingredient of the batter for pancakes in the UK?
In which country does the typical breakfast consist of Caffè e latte and a pastry?
The traditional Malayan breakfast dish Nasi lemak includes soaking rice in what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coconut cream

questions.question: In the United Kingdom, when is the wedding breakfast served?

options.text: in the morning after the wedding
in the morning before the wedding

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: at the wedding reception

questions.question: This hand game, also known as Roshambo, is used to randomly select a person for some purpose.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rock, Paper, Scissors

questions.question: Tic-tac-toe is the American name of which popular paper and pencil game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Noughts and crosses

questions.question: The title of Kurt Vonneguts book Breakfast of Champions is also the slogan of what famous American breakfast cereal?
Which word refers to the fermented soybeans that are a part of the traditional Japanese breakfast?
What meat does a proper Irish breakfast usually include?
What dish is traditionally served for breakfast in Cambodia, Thailand and Vietnam?
Which kind of breakfast is sometimes referred to as a Full Monty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Full English breakfast

questions.question: The carbonated beverage Fanta is a product of which company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coca-Cola Bottling Co.

questions.question: The name of the popular tile game, Dominoes, often considered to be the modern descendant of the dice, originated from which of these?

options.text: The name of the town it was created in

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Domino masks
